choices.text:
Tom washed 10 pairs of socks. The socks are now wet from the wash, so Tom hangs the 10 pairs of socks outside to dry. 10 hours later, he comes back outside to check on the socks. He feels each sock and notices they are all dry. He takes them back inside because they are all dry. How long will it take Tom to dry seven pairs of socks presuming the same weather conditions?
To determine how long it will take for Tom to dry 7 pairs of socks under the same weather conditions, we can use the concept of "rate per hour." In this case, if each pair of socks takes 10 hours to dry in ideal conditions, then the rate at which they dry is:

(Number of Pairs Dried / Time Taken) x Hours Per Day = Rate per Hour

In this scenario, Tom dries 10 pairs of socks in 10 hours. So we have:

(10 / 10) x 24 (hours in a day) = 75 / 24 = 3 Rows Per Day

Now that we know the rate per hour, Tom can dry his seven pairs of socks by multiplying the number of hours he wants to take by the rate per hour:

(Number of Pairs Dried / Time Taken) x Hours Per Day = Number of Sock Rows Needed To Be Made In A Day

For 7 pairs of socks, we have:

(7 / 10) x 24 (hours in a day) = 3 Rows Per Day

Since Tom wants to dry the seven pairs of socks in "x" hours, he needs to make "x/6" rows per hour. In this case, if it takes him "y" days to complete the task:

(Number of Pairs Dried / Time Taken) x Hours Per Day = Number of Sock Rows Needed To Be Made In A Day

For 7 pairs of socks and "x/6" rows per hour, we have:

(7 / (10/6)) x 24 (hours in a day) = 3 Rows Per Day

So Tom needs to make "y*3=9" rows per day for the number of days he wants to take. To complete the task within those days, we can set up an equation:

(Number of Pairs Dried / Time Taken) x Hours Per Day = Number of Sock Rows Needed To Be Made In A Day

For 7 pairs of socks and "y*3=9" rows per day, we have:

(7 / (10/6)) x 24 (hours in a day) = 9 Rows Per Day

Now, if Tom makes "z" days for the task to be completed within those days, he needs to make "y*3=9" rows per day. So we can set up another equation:

Number of Days Needed For The Task To Be Completed = Number Of Rows Per Day Needed To Complete The Task Within Those Days

For 7 pairs of socks and "z" days, we have:

(9 / (10/6)) x 24 (hours in a day) = 3 Hours Per Day

Solving for "y":

y * 3 = 9
y = 9 / 3
y = 3

So Tom needs to make 3 rows per hour, and he can complete the task within 12 days if he makes "z" days.
